client module¶

client.add_new_user(username)¶

Add new user to server

This function takes a dictionary with a user’s information and registers their data to the server.

Parameters

username (str) – user’s identifier

Returns

none

client.check_file(file, direction)¶

Validate a user input

This function ensures that the user enters a valid file list where the list contains a non-empty filename, b64 image, and a valid processing steps array.

Parameters

  • direction (str) – either “upload” or download”

  • file (list) – UPLOAD a file is a list where each item in the list

  • a file's filename, b64 image, and an array of (is) –

  • processing steps should be done (what) –

    Example: file_list = [file1, file2]
    file1 = [“image1”, b64_image1,

    [False, False, True, True, False]]

    file2 = [“image1”, b64_image1,

    [True, True, False, False, True]]

    Each processing steps array has a True if that process is desired and False if not. In this example, image1 desires to perform contrast stretching and log compression. Likewise, image2 desires the original and to perform histogram equalization and reverse video.

  • file – DOWNLOAD a file is a list where each item in the

  • is a file's filename, image download type, and (list) –

  • array of what processing steps should be downloaded (an) –

    Example: file_list = [file1, file2]
    file1 = [“image1”, “.jpg”,

    [False, False, True, True, False]]

    file2 = [“image1”, “.tiff”,

    [False, True, False, False, True]]

    Each processing steps array has a True if that process is desired and False if not. In this example, image1 desires to perform contrast stretching and log compression. Likewise, image2 desires the original and to perform histogram equalization and reverse video.

Returns

status message and status code

Return type

status (dict)

client.delete_image(username, filename)¶

Delete images under filename from the database

This function takes a username and filename and searches for the original and processed images associated with them in the MongoDB database. If found, it deletes the images and the associated metadata.

Parameters

  • username (str) – user’s identifier

  • filename (str) – file’s identifier

Returns

none

client.delete_user(username)¶

Delete user from the database

This function takes a username and searches for it in the MongoDB database. If found, it deletes the user.

Parameters

username (str) – user’s identifier

Returns

none

client.download_image(username, filename, path, proc_steps, type_ext='.png')¶

Download an image from the database

This function takes an image filename, finds the image in the database then displays it.

Parameters

  • username (str) – user identifier

  • filename (str) – name of file

  • path (str) – path to where image should be downloaded If path is ‘none’, image isn’t saved to a location.

  • proc_steps (list) – list of Booleans containing requested

  • steps such as [False, True, False, False, True] (processing) –

  • "Original" ,"Histogram Equalization", "Contrast (for) –

  • "Log Compression", and "Reverse Video" (Stretching",) –

  • type_ext (str) – image type including “.jpg”, “.tiff”,

  • ".png" where "png" is default (and) –

Returns

dictionary containing image information status (dict): status code and status message

Return type

img_info (dict)

client.download_images(username, file_list, zip_path)¶

Downloads multiple images from the database

This function takes a list of images and downloads them from the database. If the list is larger than one image, the images are put into a zip_path

Parameters

  • username (str) – user identifier

  • file_list (list) – list of files where each item in the list

  • a list of the file's filename, image type, and an array of (is) –

  • processing steps should be done (what) –

    Example: file_list = [file1, file2, file3]
    file1 = [“image1”, “.jpg”,

    [False, False, True, True, False]]

    file2 = [“image2”, “.png”,

    [False, True, False, False, True]]

    file3 = [“image3”, “.tiff”,

    [True, False, False, False, False]]

    Each processing steps array has a 1 if that process is desired and 0 if not. In this example, image1 desires to perform contrast stretching and log compression. Likewise, image2 desired to perform histogram equalization and reverse video. Image3 only desires the original image.

Returns

dictionary of status codes and and messages for each file being downloaded files_img_infos (list): list of img_info for each file being downloaded

Return type

files_status (dict of two lists)

client.proc_string(proc_steps)¶

Creates processign step string from the processing steps Boolean array.

Parameters

  • proc_steps (list) – list of 5 Boolean terms for desired processing

  • steps –

Returns

string of 5 1’s or 0’s corresponding to the True or False in the Boolean list

Return type

proc_ext (str)

client.process_image(username, filename, b64_string, proc_steps)¶

Process image

This function takes an image and sends it to the server as a string. The server then processes the image with the user- selected processing step.

Parameters

  • username (str) – user identifier

  • filename (str) – name of file

  • b64_string (str) – image string to process

  • proc_steps (list) – list of Booleans containing requested

  • steps such as [False, True, False, False, True] (processing) –

  • "Original" ,"Histogram Equalization", "Contrast (for) –

  • "Log Compression", and "Reverse Video" (Stretching",) –

Returns

status message and status code

Return type

status (dict)

client.upload_image(username, filename, b64_string)¶

Upload an image to the database

This function takes an image filename, reads in the image and converts it into a string so it can be sent to the server.

Parameters

  • username (str) – user identifier

  • filename (str) – name of file

  • b64_string (str) – image string to upload

Returns

status message and status code

Return type

status (dict)

client.upload_images(username, file_list)¶

Uploads multiple images to the database

This function takes a list of images and uploads them one by one to the database.

Parameters

  • username (str) – user identifier

  • file_list (list) – list of files where each item in the list

  • a list of the file's filename, b64 image, and an array of (is) –

  • processing steps should be done (what) –

    Example: file_list = [file1, file2]
    file1 = [“image1”, b64_image1,

    [False, False, True, True, False]]

    file2 = [“image1”, b64_image1,

    [False, True, False, False, True]]

    Each processing steps array has a True if that process is desired and False if not. In this example, image1 desires to perform contrast stretching and log compression. Likewise, image2 desired to perform histogram equalization and reverse video.

Returns

dictionary of a list of status codes and list of status messages for each file being uploaded

Return type

files_status (dict of two lists)

client.zipdir(path, ziph)¶

Function for putting everything under an existing folder into a zip folder.

This function puts all the files in an existing folder into a zipped folder and then removes it from the existing folder.

Parameters

  • path (str) – path to folder desired to be zipped

  • ziph – zipfile handle

Returns

success (bool)

BME547 Final
